channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024080292
item.description:
Report X-2024080292

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: EAST HANOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained two plastic bottles packaged with styrofoam peanuts. One bottle had a loose cap causint the release of contents. All contents of the shipment were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024070291
item.description:
Report E-2024070291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/10/2024 at 09:45 hours, DOT Inspector Alan Fisher was conducting an inspection at the CSX Manville Yard in Manville, NJ. Mr. Fisher reported a suspect release from the top of NATX301283, a loaded tank car of Acetone. CSX isolated the car and notified the shipper, Sabic Innovative Plastics, via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0710-00165). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSX emergency response contractor, responded to inspect the car. MEI personnel verified a release of product vapor due to a blind flange on the pressure plate have no gasket installed. Contractor personnel installed a gasket between blind flange and pressure plate; secured the nuts to stop the release. The condition found and corrective measure were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Skyler Davis, 812-781-4454). Following the emergency repairs outlined, the car was held pending bubble leak test by a certified mobile repair unit.

item.title: Report X-2024080735
item.description:
Report X-2024080735

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-13T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 8/3/2024 at approximately 2035, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 301180 at the hub facility in Newark, reporting a flammable spill. The shipment cosisted of 1 plastic jerrican. The shipment was discovered to have been punctured on the bottom of the jerrican resulting in spillage. The cause of the damage appear to be human error. The drum was inverted to contain the spill and placed in a salvage drum, where it awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.description:
Report X-2024080362

  • City: EDISON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 26th a package was discovered during the sort that was leaking. The box was marked as UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, PGIII. Further investigation showed that the entire contents of the package leaked out. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and will be sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024080727
item.description:
Report X-2024080727

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: SADDLE BROOK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET FROM CONDENSATION AND COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING TWO X FIVE GRAMS OF SEMAGLUTIDE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. A PACKING LIST AND CERTIFICATE OF ANALYSIS IS ATTACHED TO THE BOX. OUTER PACKAGE IS PREPRINTED RUSH, INSULATED, AND PERISHABLE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: 1. X-2024080431 The spill was due to a loosed cap on one of the contents. Approximately 0.25lg was leaked out. The remaining were placed in a lined salvage drum to await disposition information. 2. X-2024080468 The spill was due to a loosed cap on one of the contents. There were no major damages to the fiberboard box, it was wet. The remaining contents were undamaged. They were placed in a lined salvage drum to await disposal instructions.

item.title: Report X-2024080384
item.description:
Report X-2024080384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-02
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on van line appearing fully undamaged but with a strong chemical odor. Manager isolated package from sort immediately upon discovery due to strong odor, despite package not being labeled as a hazmat. QA investigated package and discovered it was an undeclared hazmat item. Outer packaging would be sufficient for hazmat item within, but is not labeled. Item was placed inside plastic bag within box, but has no additional packing material. Appears likely item moved freely within box, causing dents and forcing liquid to spill via lid seams. Leak fully contained within package.
